title: [Azure Files] Copy() wrapper not polling for copy to succeed/fail before returning

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`



#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
I am a developer from Azure Files. We are investigating an issue reported by a customer which seems to show that the client is using rclone and is doing a copyfile from file A to file B followed by a renamefile from file C to file B.

It seems that in Azure Files copy() wrapper routine as referred here : https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/backend/azurefiles/azurefiles.go#L1316 does not poll for the completion of the copy before returning.
In similar code for Azure Blob, for the copy() wrapper routine, https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/backend/azureblob/azureblob.go#L1987
we can see that the rclone client is polling whether copyStatus is CopyStatusTypePending or not, as shown below, which is missing for Azure FIles.

	// Poll for completion if necessary
	//
	// The for loop is never executed for same storage account copies.
	copyStatus := startCopy.CopyStatus
	getOptions := blob.GetPropertiesOptions{}
	pollTime := 100 * time.Millisecond
	for copyStatus != nil && string(*copyStatus) == string(container.CopyStatusTypePending) {
		time.Sleep(pollTime)
		var getMetadata blob.GetPropertiesResponse
		err = f.pacer.Call(func() (bool, error) {
			getMetadata, err = dstBlobSVC.GetProperties(ctx, &getOptions)
			return f.shouldRetry(ctx, err)
		})
		if err != nil {
			return nil, err
		}
		copyStatus = getMetadata.CopyStatus
		pollTime = min(2*pollTime, time.Second)
	}

Due to this bug on the client, we can run into an edge case which can make the file inaccessible for the client. 

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone version shows up on the server as v1.71.0
This seems to be a day 0 issue from when the azure files support was added. i.e v1.65.0 from 2023-11-26 onwards

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
At this point, it is not clear from how the customer is using rclone

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
Azure Files

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
From the signature that I see on the server, the customer is doing a copyfile followed by renamefile using REST.

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
I do not have that information.
